Reviews.Title: “Inefficient staff, rowdy crowds outside 'til 3am!”
Reviews.Author: BeckyWestLondon
Reviews.Content: On our arrival in the early evening, front desk had no trace of our room reservation we had made 10 weeks in advance through BA website. We had to wait 20 minutes while they searched through computer data, then allocated us the last room available in the hotel. Unfortunately, this was first floor at the front overlooking a busy street and opposite a rowdy football themed bar whose drinkers used our hotel entrance as a smoking area. The singing and shouting went on below our window until 3am each night of our 3 night stay making it impossible to get to sleep, then the early morning noisy delivery of metal barrels woke us at 7am. Front of house staff seemed unconcerned when we reported this and said this was to be expected in a city centre but could not relocate us to a quieter room as none were free. No compensation was offered. The room had seen better days, being tired and shabby with torn curtains, poor lighting, no mirror, no tea and coffee making facilities. The shower hose was broken and leaking making it difficult to use. On the day of departure, we asked reception to order a cab to take us to the airpor,t which they had previously assured us would be no problem and will arrive to collect us within 5 minutes. Wrong! After waiting 25 minutes, reception told us they were unable to book us a cab as there was a major football match in Barcelona that day and that we should hail a cab on La Rambla. We left the hotel with all our luggage only to find that all passing cabs were occupied. We eventuallly managed to secure a cab by walking all the way down to the port area and waiting a further 30 minutes by the main road until a cab stopped for us. Do not listen to advice offered by staff at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and upkept”
Reviews.Author: Natasha B
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was really good especially if you like shopping. Right on the las ramblas. The hotel looked like it used to be really nice but the wall are dirty and fixtures are broken. The bed was hard. The shower leaked. We requested 2 queen beds and instead we got 2 singles and I of our room had 2 singles and bunk beds. The staff were friendly but check in was long The one good thing was each room had a laptop and free wifi

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Elrillo
Reviews.Content: Great location a minute from Ramblas and near shops, the beach, placa Catalunya and the gothic quarters. The rooms are nicely furnished and has a really good bed. We got a room facing the inner garden which meant no disturbing sounds. You could get noice from the corridor or the bathroom however (depending on the status on your spouses stommac) since the door to the corridor was badly sealed and the door to the bathroom was just a swinging glass door. Nice breakfast and a computer in each room. We found it perfect for us, a couple from Sweden. When I booked the room I specifically asked for a room without a view into a ventilation shaft, wich was exactly what we got when we arrived. They sorted this out without a problem the next day though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, odd layout!”
Reviews.Author: lumamahdi
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two days in this hotel, March 20&21 of 2012. we had the family room. The location is great as you are near the Las Ramblas and Liceu metro station is only a walking distance of about 120 meters. The staff are friendly but the initial check in took longer than other hotels as they had to enter the passport numbers manually ! Then the receptionist didn't offer us with any information about the city (we didn't need this but it's customary to provide these information to any non Spanish speaking visitor)! the room is on the other side of the hotel and you have to take your luggage yourself and cross the garden which has many steps up & down! The room layout is similar in all HT Hotels which we didn't like the lack of bathroom privacy! You need to book for the breakfast and it's between 7.30 to 10.00 am. Walking distance from great historic sites esp. Mares museum and the Barcelona Cathedral as well as the gothic quarter and all it's treasures. The beds were not very comfortable and the staff offered to change the room for the next day but to move a whole family and their stuff for another few hours of sleep wasn't worth the move! I may go back to same hotel but not with a family and not in a rainy season!

Reviews.Title: “Basic and Small with Average Cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: nic1h1
Reviews.Content: This was a hotel that I would only advise people who really arent that bothered with accomodation and more the city they are in to book. The room was amazingly small but was suitable for the five days we were there. The lobby was smelly, like toilet which often after a shower the rooms bathroom had the same smell. Its very sickly and I would advise if you are in the early stages of pregnancy and particularly queezy.. dont book. -The receptionist was sharp with us but in saying that she wasnt the worst ive met she was quite miserable as well, didnt make us feel particularly comfortable like! But thats her miserable life not mine!! the decor although very cheap, was ok. nicer than hostels. the room was average when it came to cleanliness, the maids didnt change our beds for the 5 days we were there which i found odd. there was no or very little noise polution for the location of the hotel, so we did get some good sleeps. The view was of a white wall belonging to another building, quite depressing. All in all i wouldnt go back and I wouldnt reccomend it but thats just my opinion, good luck :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KarenandDale
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a great location. It was average, but the rooms were clean. Hotel needs updating. Service at the front desk was slow and did not return e-mails to confirm stay. I booked on SpainBookers and it was great. All was in order when we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Barcelona!!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaE2
Reviews.Content: we stayed 6,Nights @ petit palace located just a few steps from Ramblas and 2 blocks ,from Boquerias market,best place to buy all kinds of fresh/organic fruits!!cheese,Hotel has a great location to everything Cheers Bar & Tapas across from hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loving Barcelona and our hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Susie0421
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from this hotel today, I thought I would write a review as we've had a fantastic time and very much enjoyed our stay in this hotel. It's situation is perfect, literally 1 mins walk from Las Ramblas. Hotel is clean, reception staff helpful and welcoming! We stayed 3 nights. We were allocated a room through the gardens at the back. This was fine, the gardens were being re-landscaped but it is February, so it has to be done sometime, and it certainly wasn't a problem. Lights come on in corridors automatically. We are a family of 4, age 11 & 16. Room was spacious, a double bunk as we went in the door, then round a corner, and then another double bunk and our twin beds. Fairly comfortable, we all slept well. I defy anyone to say hotel beds are the best, and these certainly weren't bad. Not loads of wardrobe space, but not a major problem as only there a few days. Free wifi in the rooms via a laptop which is provided, or get given a code for phones or iPods etc. Breakfast is lovely, best meal of the day and this certainly provides all you need, juices, cereal, cooked sausage, egg and mushrooms, cold meat, cheeses, fruit, yogurt, and different pastries, croissants, cake and bread. Decor is modern, but we thought it was great. The hotel also has character a bit of old and new. We really couldn't fault this hotel and I would recommend to friends!!!

Reviews.Title: “Opera Garden Hotel, Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: petewilliams
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I recently visited Barcelona (Jan 2012) for the first time and we were amazed by the place and had a great time visiting a lot of the normal visitor attractions however we were very disappointed with the hotel we had chosen. The Opera Garden Hotel is approximately half way up the famous La Rambla street and is just inside the Old Quarter of the city. Whilst its location was great, the hotel itself - and particularly the room itself was small (even by European standards) and dirty. The view was onto the back of the neighbouring properties and the room consisted of a small bathroom which wasn't very clean, but had a walk in type shower, a small built in wardrobe - with faulty sliding doors and a small bed. Despite asking for a king size bed when we booked and thinking we were going to get one, we ended up having a less than queen size bed crammed into a small space, made even more difficult to get round by them squeezing in a small desk and chair (the chair being almost impossible to sit on due to the proximity of the bed). The room's decor left a lot to be desired - bright Orange on the Wall complete with Orange lamp shade!! More importantly the walls showed lots of dirty marks that looked like they had been there for years. To be fair the room did say it had internet in the rooms and this was through the medium of a laptop computer - so that was a plus point if nothing else. In summary - the hotel is well situated for those persons wishing to explore Barcelona but the individual rooms are very small, have little or no views and you may well end up in room 3515 - avoid this room at all costs if you don't want to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Appropriate Location and Good room”
Reviews.Author: Taner_tr06
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights as a 4 persons family. Room was clean, usefull, warm and quiet. Unfortunately there was no king size bed in the family room. Bathroom was clean but need to repaired. Location is very suitable to reach every connection. Personnel were looked like busy but thanks god, they answered our questions. Breakfast was good. There was non-pork salami.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad and The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: Polly58_08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short break in January and when booking was seduced by the romantic name and the impression from the hotel's pictures into thinking that it was a building with character. It could be said that this it had in plenty but not of the anticipated variety ! The Good: The location for the hotel could not be faulted - just off La Ramblas, in the oldest part of the town. Hence the belief the hotel would displays some character and interesting nooks and crannies. Free internet is a plus, useful and a saving if you need access to your pc. The Bad: The hotel has definitely seen better days and any grandeur implied by the name and location has long since disappeared. The rooms are grubby and in need of redecoration with scuffed paint and wall paper. The cover on the bed was none too clean, with stains of an indefinable source. The size of the room was tiny and I mean tiny, with barely enough room to get in or out of bed at either side and further cramped by a desk and plastic chair beside it which had insufficient room to pull out and sit on. The Ugly: The colour schemes in the bedrooms are particulary vivid - ours was a lovely shade of satsuma orange which almost necessitated the use of sunglasses. In contrast the corridors and hallways are black with sensors which illuminate the passageways as you pass -by. I know Barcelona is a mecca for stylists and a by- word for design but this hotel has unfortunately has none.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you favour technology over comfort”
Reviews.Author: EmmaBrussels
Reviews.Content: Very good location just of Las Ramblas but difficult to find, instructions could be clearer and map is confusing maybe if you have your smartphone gps then.... Our room was like a cell with garish cold blue/ white colour scheme /lighting and worn grey carpet but if being connected is important then you have a laptop and free wi-fi provided. Shower could not be controlled lower than scalding. Not a hotel to relax in after a long day on your feet - no bar, no chill out seating just a tired old purple couch. OK in summer you could sit in their garden which should be shady but no couches! Not a hotel chosen by me but was a gift so can't complain too much also would probably suit some (younger?) people but it reminded me of a busy Travel Lodge.Breakfast buffet adequate but busy. Wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great location”
Reviews.Author: TimTheCurious
Reviews.Content: First, the location is about 30 meters off Las Ramblas on Carrer de la Boquería. You will not find this hotel where Google maps or your iPhone shows it. Room was nice enough, and a good set-up for a family of 4 (bunk beds for the kids). Our room was fairly quiet. Hotel staff were friendly. In-room WiFi is free but get a ticket from reception for each device.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but opposite a bar open until 5am!!”
Reviews.Author: sweetpeaCheltenham
Reviews.Content: We had a family room on the first floor opposite a rowdy bar which stayed open until 5am. I had to have ear plugs to sleep. The decor is faded, shabby and not very clean. There is damp up the walls, the tiles in the bathroom are dirty. There was only german or spanish tv. No coffee /tea making facilities. I am not sure why this hotel is supposed to be a 4 star. I would class it as a 2 star. I have stayed in a High tech hotel in Madrid which was much nicer/cleaner etc. The top bunk bed has no guard rail and was too dangerous for a child to sleep in, however the hotel provided a single bed on the second night. The only positive thing I have to say about this hotel is it's central location just off Las Ramblas but for this we paid the price of not being able to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - terrible beds”
Reviews.Author: cruisequeenCalgary
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic, just a half block off The Ramblas, facing onto a very tiny little "street", and backing onto a lovely courtyard. The buffet breakfast was a good start to our day. The beds however were extremely hard and uncomfortable - after 2 nights we were aching and desperate for a good nights sleep, and did make our complaint known to a totally disinterested front desk male. On night 3, we slept on top of all the blankets etc. to soften the blow! Our room was very small and sparse - no amenities - basic at best. The shower was backed up, and the hand held shower was about to disconnect - both were reported to the front desk and fixed by the time we returned to the room. The front desk staff were either excellent, or terribly unfriendly and not the least interested in assisting in any way. There is an excellent walking tour that starts from the hotel lobby, just before 11 a.m., and would certainly recommend it. It's about 2.5 hours all through the Gothic area, and payment is by voluntary tips at the end. Very worthwhile for sure.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed in :~)”
Reviews.Author: tayac
Reviews.Content: Brilliant place ! Very modern interior in an old building. Super color schemes. Excellent breakfast buffet. It's a stones throw from the Ramblas, the food market and near the metro. The best part for me was the gorgous shady garden at the rear of the Hotel. One could chill out after a hard days fun in the city :~) It's light at night for a wine before bedtime. I'd reccomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location if you can find it”
Reviews.Author: WeeSweeno
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Barcelona with our two kids for a long weekend. Barcelona is a great city for a short break. The Petit Palace Opera Garden is in a good central place to base yourself from. Upon arrival we spent ages trying to find this hotel. We took a taxi from the airport. The driver queried the address that we gave him. After a bit of head scratching he dropped us off on the Ramblas near La Boquería market. I tried to locate the hotel using my iPhone but it was not where the phone said it would be. We found a tourist information centre and they sent us the wrong way too. There are a few Petit Palace hotels in Barcelona. The Opera Garden is not located on the north edge of La Boquería market as show in Google maps and on my iPhone. It is actually across the main street to the east of the Ramblas near to Liceu metro station (south entrance). A former umbrella store decorated with brollies and a large green Chinese dragon mark the corner where you turn off the Ramblas into the narrow Carrer de la Boquería. The hotel is then about 30 paces along on your right. Map attached. The hotel is just far enough from the main thoroughfare to be quiet at night. The hotel facilities are basic. Our room was large with a massive double bed and bunk beds for the kids. The AC was efficient and not too noisy. Our room came with free wifi. You just need to ask reception for an access code. Our room also had a complementary laptop computer packed full of games! They kids loved that. There are three more laptops in the foyer for guests to use - handy for planning your day's excursions. The room was cleaned every day and provided with sufficient towels and toiletries. It could do with a deep clean however to rid the walls and ceiling of mould caused I presume by condensation. This is illustrated in the photos provided by other guests on this page. Our bathroom had a shower above a bath that was fitted with spa jets. We did not use the spa facility but it had a nasty habit of activating by itself soon after you leave the shower. That happened without fail within a few minutes of every shower that we had.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a four-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: SVTraveller
Reviews.Content: If I had paid for a two or three star hotel, it would have rated an "adequate", but for an allegedly four-star, it was very disappointing. The room was very small and minimalist in that it only had a bed and a two-foot wide open cabinet for hanging items. There was a tiny desk with a laptop on it, but no chair - no chair anywhere. The flat-screen tv was hung on the wall at the bottom of the bed making it very difficult to negotiate the 18 inch walkway. Bed was a bit hard, pillows way too soft, which are personal preferences, however no spare blanket or pillow. Bathroom was reasonable size with a big, soaker, tub and a nice shower head, adequate towels. After our room neighbors had come back at night, it was pleasantly quiet. The garden area could be a lot nicer, but at least it was there. Staff were efficient but not particularly friendly. We had to haul our considerable luggage up a long flight of stairs - someone helped us on the way to the room, but we were on our own for checkout. Price didn't include breakfast so we didn't eat there. Given its very convenient location, I would possibly stay there again - if I could get it for a two-star price and it was only for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Petit Palace Opera Garden Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: CJM_MI
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just a few steps off the Ramblas (a pedestrian avenue with a narrow roads on either side for traffic). A great location. This is where the action is and where you can catch the metro or walk or take the city tour bus for sightseeing). I booked a room for 4 (not too may hotels offer a room for 4 in Barcelona). The room was clean with two twin beds together as a full and one set of bunk beds (one single upper / one single lower ) The mattresses were on the extra firm side. The room was clean. A laptop was provided in the room with internet access - no extra charge. You cannot check in until 2:00pm but they do store your luggage in a locked room. The reason I only rated the hotel as average was for their customer service. They seemed more interested in answering the phone than checking in the guests. There was a long line and very slow. No smiling faces.

Reviews.Title: “The Beautiful Garden”
Reviews.Author: LizMcK59
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very convenient to la Rambla & public transport. Our room overlooked the terrace at the rear of the hotel. To describe the garden and terrace as "beautiful" is a gross exaggeration. It could be so beautiful (as shown on the website). however it is sadly neglected with the plants dead or dying. The decking and paving is very shabby. The bar does not exist (except for 2 vending machines dispensing crisps,soft drinks and lager),The buffet breakfast is expensive. The televisions do not appear able to provide an English speaking programmes,the computer did not work properly indeed the technology appeared to be causing problems.We had to move rooms as the electronic shower failed!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Oasis off Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: cdcalnan
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 weeks during peak season just steps away from Las Ramblas, yet in the "back rooms" off the courtyard it was peaceful. The rooms were modern, tasteful, and well maintained by the friendly staff. The air conditioning unit was effective and quiet. The location was superb: walk to the Liceu Metro in 2 min, market in 3 min, beach in 25. Be prepared to queue for a few minutes on check-in as their administrative process could use some streamlining. Front desk staff pleasant and helpful in several languages and available 24 hours. Buffet breakfast nicely presented but there are restaurants every few steps in this area offering breakfast as well - finding good food in Barcelona is not a problem. Be cautious of your belongings - petty thieves operate in the hotel's public areas!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: meneurwen
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel could have not been better, metro station is just 2 minutes from the hotel, so is la rambla. Great for sightseeing and shopping. The hotel is a four star hotel, I would give it two stars though. The rooms were small but ok, the bathroom was mold infested. I wouldn't stay here again, but would search for a hotel near this location.

Reviews.Title: “We had a very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Martin G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 days in the middle of August - 2 adults with 2 girls. Our room was a suite on the first floor which looks out directly over the main hotel entrance. The room was modern and very comfortable, although the top bunk on the girls bed did not have any kind of barrier to stop the occupant from falling out of bed during the night! Air con was very welcome, as the outside temperature was in the 30's and it was quite humid. The lap top provided was also very useful. Despite previous negative comments on this site, we found the service from the hotel staff excellent, and the reception staff very helpful when I wanted to print off boarding passes for our flight home. The main drawback was the permanent noise from the street outside. There was no start or end time for the noise - it continued 24 hours a day, although I would imagine that the rooms not overlooking the street do not suffer from this problem. Some of the facilities were a little shabby. For example, the bathroom was very modern in design, but the holder for the shower head was missing, so we would have to hold the shower head throughout when showering, or put it on the shower floor! All in all we had a very good stay. Look out for the grumpy waitress at the restaurant opposite (Gaudi Tapas). She was the only person who did not get a tip.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly better than recent reviews”
Reviews.Author: Raerone
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay July 21-24. There were several recent unfavorable reviews and so we were very apprehensive. We found the hotel staff helpful and friendly; the room was clean, well appointed; with excellet lighting And modern bath. The location is awesome and we never heard a peep from outside. The only negative was that the breakfast buffet was not very good. There are several cafes a block or 2 away that offer a good breakfast at reasonable prices

Reviews.Title: “Upscale and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: scottalanbeck
Reviews.Content: The taxi driver was lost and dropped us off 500 yards from the hotel and we had to tug our luggage throught the pedestrian street only to find the Petit Palace steps from La Ramblas! We were greeted nicely and allowed to keep our luggage in their holding area until check in so we could do some sightseeing. The room was very well appointed and we used the internet connection to check mail and our flights. Very clean and comfortable. The inside restaurant was VERY expensive so we ate outside.

Reviews.Title: “One of the dirtiest hotels we've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Athena2003
Reviews.Content: To start with the positive: this hotel was a 1 minute or less walk to the Liceu metro stop in Barcelona, practially on las ramblas and everything in the Barri Gotic was walkable from here. The decor of the hotel was very modern and interesting and there was a courtyard in back that seemed nice. To the rest: the walls in the room were filthy, there was a wallpaper covered hole in the wall, there were flies that despite how many we killed kept popping up, the shower was dirty, etc. We were there four days and our room was serviced twice (which seemed to really only be making the bed as the bathroom was still not cleaned). We asked for a wake up call our last day to assure we'd make our flight; no one called. The hallways were pitch black until you triggered a sensor and the lights flashed on. Despite our room not facing Las Ramblas or even c/Boqueria we were woken up repeatedly in the middle of the night as the walls offered no insulation from the noise. If you choose to stay here, do not pay to have breakfast included as it's 9 euro/pp and you can walk less than a block in any direction and find way better places to eat for a fraction of the price. Had our command of the Catalan spanish been better, we would have started calling around to find another hotel room after our first night.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: nextportofcall
Reviews.Content: Our family of four spent one night in this modern and centrally located hotel. Big and clean room with the kids in a bunk bed and a modern spacious bathroom with shower. Located right in the heart of Las Ramblas. We only stayed one night and had an early start to the airport so really did not have the opportunity to explore the hotel and try the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: JakeMChicago
Reviews.Content: Wifi in the room never worked. Despite repeated do not disturb signs posted, they still came in the room to clean. The location is great opposite the Liceu Metro on the Ramblas but that's where it ends. I will be asking Priceline for a refund.

Reviews.Title: “Shamblas on the Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: davethexj12
Reviews.Content: Oh Dear .. Arrived 2nd July mid am .. Early check-in was pre booked ,reception understaffed so slow queque and then only to find they wouldn't allow early check in .. Left bags and returned 4pm. Long and slow queque again ..Got to room after about 1 hour .. Not Double as booked but Twin . Returned to reception .They finally agree to change us to a double in the morning,but we had to book out next morning then book in again .. Booking in again 3rd July late afternoon .Quequed about 2 hours , Only 1 receptionist in Hotel (No other staff to be seen) Problems with just about every Customer in front of us .Varying from no room even available at all for one pre-booked family to several cases of rooms not ready or not cleaned . A lobby full of angry,upset and disgruntled people ,It decended into a scene from Fawlty Towers .. Finally got our new room key ..went to room only to find it was not a double but another twin room same as before . . The best we got to anywhere near an apology was the "senior" receptionist agreeing with me the next morning that "he would have been angry too!" We really couldn't be bothered to go throught the rigmoral of changing again...Oh and the Internet didn't work properly in our room Most times you passed reception there was some guest complaining. On the up-side ..Our own rooms were clean and the shower was nice.The fresh Orange with breakfast was superb and the hotel location is good but overall Managerial wise it needs a more effort

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant stay - avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: josii11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights after arriving at their sister hotel Petit Palace Museum Barcelona to find they had lost our reservation (booked by our travel agent!). They moved us to Petit Palace Opera Garden with no apology and we were met by a very unpleasant lady at reception who did not appear to be expecting us from the other hotel. Communication between the hotels and staff members was severely lacking, let alone their appalling customer service to guests. We had booked a deluxe king room but the room we were given was clearly a family room with 2 singles pushed together (as many European hotels do for a queen/king bed) and a set of bunk beds. As they were fully booked we could not change rooms. The sheets were clean but old with a large hole in one of them. The room was of decent size with a large bathroom with bath and shower. The water pressure was terrible it took literally 45 minutes to half fill the bath and the shower was no more than a trickle. Toilet also did not flush properly. The bench/desk in the room is made of white laminate which had numerous chips out of it and pen drawing marks. A lap top was provided in each room and downstairs in reception with free internet. The in-room safe also did not work and when we asked staff to address it they said they couldn't spare any one to go up to the room. We also noticed a pubic hair stuck in a plastic sleeve in the hotel information book - disgusting!! Breakfast was included in the room rate which was served downstairs in a buffet. Plenty to choose from with lots of fruit and pastries plus ham, salamis, cheeses etc. Breakfast definitely needed a re-paint - certainly not 4 star standard!! Location of the hotel is excellent as it is just off La Ramblas (actually better than their sister hotel) so well situated for the tourist hot spots and great selection of restaurants nearby. We walked to some places and took the metro to further places such as the Sagrada Familia Cathedral. Overall the hotel needs a serious re-vamp to warrant the 4 star rating and the staff need an attitude check! Not worth the price or the stress if you can avoid it stay somewhere else in the gorgeous city of Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great location,certainly not 4-star,minimalist room,disastrous front of house staff”
Reviews.Author: MFC25
Reviews.Content: Great location just off La Ramblas but not noisy.My wife and I stayed end of June 2011.Room is minimalistic with no wardrobe or drawers for clothes storage.Room is more akin to "Travelodge" in size and decor.Rock hard beds gave us both sore backs.Laptop internet in room-briliant when it worked.Bathroom fantastic-walk in shower and great modern shower facility.Air-con just about adequate.At >150 Euros per night I thought that this was very expensive. On arrival at Reception I had to wait 1 hour 15 minutes (!!!!)to get booked in!! The 3 reception staff were either incompetent or poorly trained.It required the intervention of someone more senior to sort out our room.There was only 1 pillow in our bedroom so we asked reception for another.After 3 hours there was no second pillow so I went down to Reception again and was told that the hotel didn't have any more pillows!!! The following day I asked the maid for another pillow which she provided within minutes-complete laziness/incompetence by Reception staff. The garden looks nice on the photo's but in reality is scruffy and unkempt. Certainly not 4-star and poor value.Wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Un professional Service”
Reviews.Author: AIndresh
Reviews.Content: The Hotel forced me into paying the Room Charges in advance, inspite of giving them a Credit Card details as a Deposit. Un heard off in this Industry. I was moved to Opera Garden, as their Petit Palace BCN In Barcelona caught fire, and as such they shifted us to Opera Garden.

Reviews.Title: “smart, sleek and clean”
Reviews.Author: tiamaria19
Reviews.Content: I came here last summer for partly business and leisure. the rooms were of a good standard spacious and modern. laptops and free internet use throughout. breakfast was a great selection of hot and cold buffet. the hotel was clean throughout and staff friendly. If I stayed in barcelona again and needed to be centrally located this would be absolutely ideal just tucked away slightly off the the main strip it is not noisy at night and as a light sleeper and being in a city location would normally prove difficult to get any sleep but I had no trouble. Short walk to main historical attractions beach a walkable distance, about 20 mins to half an hour, and good shopping, market is a must I cant remember which day it is but lots of beautifully crafted gifts like jewellery and art to look at or buy!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - no air con!”
Reviews.Author: Lihou94
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 100 yards off La Ramblas (have luggage on wheels as no traffic allowed) which quite frankly is an area that is not all it's cracked up to be in as much as its very crowded, full of thieves and just about everyone is trying to rip you off, from the shops selling fake Barce FC shirts to the restaurants that will give you the most expensive tapas on the menu if you simply ask for a selection. That said, the hotel was good value (booked through Travel Republic) for a family room and there were plenty of places to go for breakfast if you don't want to eat at the hotel (7.5 euro a head for breakfast). Nearest bar/ restaurants are right opposite hotel. The family room was adequate with two single beds together and bunk beds for the kids although with no aircon it was far too hot even in April (although you could open the door to the tiny balcony but then you had the noise). This is a 'high tec' hotel and the laptop in the room is a bonus but the room is somewhat minimalist which I don't particularly have a problem with but in my view, this sort of room/ building needs a better finish than I found here. I gather this hotel is fairly new but various things were falling to bits already! The shower looked impressive but when you put it on, it sprayed across the whole room because of the poor design. No english TV channels and you will find a travel kettle and tea and coffee makings useful. There is a mini bar fridge that you can empty and store your own drinks in. The staff were friendly and efficient and there is a nice garden with comfortable seating for lounging around on. Although there was no bar operating when we were there, there was a bar which I assume may operate in the high season but if not you can get some take outs from the supermarket up the road! All in all, good value, in what some would consider to be a good location if you can put up with a hot room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: TalFamiljaRestaurant
Reviews.Content: Hi , just booked for my parents last week at this hotel. Which i did not know the result was going to turn out, but since there is the trip advisor i went in to have a look at it . so i booked !! The hotel looked nice from the pictures and my family said that it was nothing special as a hotel, but hey lisen if you are going for a holiday like my parents did !!! And you are that type of person who enjoy staying out in barcelona CENTER, then this would be good for you otherwise they complained about not having Air-Condition in there Rooms and small Rooms which was a bit uncountable for them, and this was the Family Room and the others was a Room by 2 which was said the same.

Reviews.Title: “great location, disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: HampshirePanda8
Reviews.Content: A good deal and great location made this our choice for a short break just before christmas. However in spite of our booking a family room, it was clearly far too small for our family. Once the bunk beds were up and a travel cot put in we could not move around the room at all, not helped by not having any storage either.We also found our bed, which was 2 singles shunted together moved every time we either sat or lay on it, sending anything we put on the bedside flying. We also tried to use the glass shelving above the bed, which was also lighting but the glass shelf kept falling into itself. We did not have the breakfast but found plenty of places to eat no problem.(and plenty of starbucks). I did also ask for a kettle but was only offered a teapot. I bought one at a local store, but advise you bring a travel one as this was an expensive option. The shower was functional but not as flash as it looked with poor water pressure and a shower head that could use some tlc, or replacing!, The clear bonus was having a computer and internet access in the room which allowed us to keep up with news of the weather disruption and enabled us to plan an alternative journey home. (There were no english channels on the tv.) For location it was ideal but for 4 star it definitely lacked some basic attributes to justify this rating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ALW071
Reviews.Content: I had great service from the hotel. The staff were very friendly and the room had excellent facilities for the money I paid. The best thing about the hotel though is the great location. It is very close to La Rambas and the market, restaurants and a supermarket are all close by. Perfect location to make the most of your trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: macmack73
Reviews.Content: I thought the location was great right where the action is but quiet once inside. The previous reviews are fairly accurate. We were there for 8 nights, the beds are very firm (read Hard) my husband liked this, I did not. Not everything worked well every day. I.e. the jetted tub only worked two days, the shower was a little confusing. The hotel staff was young and not all experienced so sometimes they were helpful and sometimes not. Overall the location outweighed the problems. We did not buy the breakfast service, there are many options very close that are better. I would recommend the hotel but only for those who are flexible.

Reviews.Title: “good room, but bad service”
Reviews.Author: TokyoGreg
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Petit Palace in Seville and enjoyed it, so we decided to stay with the same chain in Barcelona. The service, however, was NOT ideal. In particular, one of the men at the desk seemed to have a chip on his service. I noticed him dealing in a quite brisk and surly manner with several hotel guests. It just was not what I expected. There is still construction going on.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Jess123-10
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel last minute and thought I had a really good deal. - £460 for 3 nights no breakfast. It was advertised as 4 star, but was in really poor condition. In our deal we had an 'executive double' which was nothing of the sort - a small double bed with only 2 feet space all round it, with a window facing a wall only feet away. We complained and were upgraded to a larger double but only very slightly. All the rooms were very tired looking with chipped paint and old bathrooms. They were doing a lot of building work which made a mess everywhere. The only good point was the location.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION, POOR CLEANLINESS AND SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: mike504164
Reviews.Content: Very noisy and dusty building site next to hotel. We had no bath towels on second night. The bath had previous customers hairs in it for the three nights we stayed there. The garden was in a terrible mess and the furniture was not usable. There was no bar.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but we'd still go back.”
Reviews.Author: TandyWhitebits
Reviews.Content: This was booked as a surprise weekend break by my husband, so I luckily hadn't read any of the bad reviews about the hotel or it might have put me off. On arrival we immediately noticed major building work being done to the left of the entrance and commented that we hoped it wouldn't disturb us too much. Once inside it turned out to not be work being done next door, but actually in the hotel itself! Rather worried, we were shown to our room which was at the back of the garden and told we were put there 'as it was quiet'. We did think this rather dubious when hearing how loud the work outside was, but we needn't have worried because once inside, all was quiet and we were never disturbed by any noise throughout our stay there. The only real inconvenience of the building work was that the gardens (which did look lovely at night) were pretty unusable as the furniture and floor were covered in dust and debris and obviously not being cleaned while this work was continuing. Like other reviews we agree that the hotel rooms are certainly not 4 star, probably more a 3 star. The room seemed a little tired and just a few small touches such as tea and coffee in the room, a chair or sofa and better towels would have made all the difference. That said the room we had was large and the bathroom good, even if the bed was a little too hard and lacking in pillows. The TV was pretty basic but then we weren't staying in Barcelona to watch TV! The room's laptop and free wifi were a boon and helped us plan trips and keep an eye on emails while away. Although not a 4 star internally, perhaps the rating is due to it being right on La Ramblas and within walking distance of everything, with markets, restaurants and loads to do in every direction. So overall it wasn't absolutely brilliant, but with building work and refurbishment being completed at the end of the month, very friendly staff (both on the desk and the cleaning staff too) and it being in such a great position we both felt at the end of our stay that we'd happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ....”
Reviews.Author: holidaysinsun
Reviews.Content: We had a great room at the back of the hotel on the second floor with its own balony (across the courtyard/garden). It was quite and we did enjoy using the garden in the evening beffore finally going to bed. We thought the location of the hotel was hard to beat but as a 4 star hotel, we quite frankly thought it needed a clean - thinks just seemed a little slap dash.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location - Poor Quality Room”
Reviews.Author: CML_2009
Reviews.Content: Location The location of this hotel is immediately off of La Rambla and almost opposite the Boqueria, Barcelona's famous open food market. Additionally, there are numerous restaurants, bars and shops steps away from the front entrance. Room I had high expectations for this hotel based upon the pictures I viewed prior to my trip. The hotel looked modern and upscale; however, upon arrival, I quickly noticed the lack of attention to detail in the room, e.g., missing floor boards, scratches and dents on the shelving and walls, splotchy painting and clogged shower drain. In addition, part of the hotel is currently under renovation, and on each morning except Sunday, my wife and I were awoken to the sound of a cement mixer and jackhammers. Not a very pleasant way to spend vacation mornings. Based upon the current progress of the renovation, I would guess these sounds will continue through July 2010. Recommendation Due to the above-mentioned defects, I would not recommend this hotel for $200/night. I would recommend this hotel for the $120-$140 price range.

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonJem
Reviews.Content: We booked an executive room, looking forward to a thrilling, luxurious, long weekend in Barcelona. We both travel a lot, so this would be a weekend for Us. The rooms on the internet site looked fantastic, but the one we were allocated was tiny. There is some creative photography taking place in those pictures! When we opened the bathroom door it hit the side of the bed. There were no facilities in the room apart from a computer (wireless access didn't work); a minibar that wasn't stocked; and a single chair for us to take turns to sit on. So no room service possible, even if it had been available. At very best, a 3* hotel. The curtain was hanging off the rail at one end and the net was dirty. The view was ... of a brick wall. The sheet had a blood stain on it. The latter was at least changed after we reported it. We asked for another room, but were told this was the best we could have, since it would be "too noisy" at the front of the hotel (that's right, it was a decision made for us by hotel staff, we had no choice!). If we had the time, we would have looked for another place to stay, but didn't want to ruin our short holiday by spending hours looking for somewhere else. The garden (which was a real mess) and bar were unavailable until summer, another major disappointment. We were told there was a supermarket where we could buy bottled water (at 11 pm) which we declined to investigate. Service was poor, very much a "take it or leave it" attitude. I could never recommend this hotel, it was an experience we would not want to repeat. Fortunately, Barcelona is a wonderful city and once we escaped from the hotel we enjoyed ourselves very much exploring the works of Gaudi; taking a bus tour (highly recommend); and relaxing on the beach with a glass of wine. Mmmm. We will be back in 2010, but definitely not to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BAD DIRTY SMALL”
Reviews.Author: sftraveler1946
Reviews.Content: This hotel 's rooms are very small, worn-out and dirty. The promose WIFI and none available in ore 6 night stay. Advertised air conditioning and there was none even though it was hot outside and noisy so opening the windows was not an option. NO English speaking TV...ALL THIS IN A "hi teck" hotel....BAD

Reviews.Title: “Pity about the pub outside”
Reviews.Author: ron046
Reviews.Content: i booked the hotel before i read the reviews ( i know! ). i decided to keep an open mind and give it a go. The location is great. the room was on the 3rd floor at the front of the hotel. the room was hot as ther was no air conditioning as it was not peak season. the showers were not very strong or very warm. the top beds on the " bunk beds" could not be used as there were no sides and so were not safe. the pillows were too thin. dispite all this we would have been happy because of the location but there is what i would call a pub on the opposite side of the narrow medevil alleyway which created a great deal of noise. we asked to be moved that night. the receptionist did not seem at all surprised. the new room was at the back of the hotel. it was cooler and quieter although we could still hear what we think was the subway trains and the sink leaked. if you are out partying till 3. am then it`s fine but i would not recommend this hotel for families or if you like your sleep after a hard days sightseeing. i could not even give it a 2 star rating as you cannot sleep if you at the front of the hotel. if you get the right hotel Barcelona is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: SBW2270
Reviews.Content: If you want to be right in the middle of it all, this is the place to stay. It is "downtown" so expect the outdoor nighttime noise one would have in any downtown area. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. The staff was great, very accomodating and throughly fluent in English. The location - who could ask for more if you want to be right where everything is. Markets, shopping, tapas bars, museums, the aquarium, etc. all right there - a block or 2 away or a short walk. Staff directed us to the best beaches, times to go places, etc.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: monchotico
Reviews.Content: Noisy, Unsafe, dirty. Don't waste your money. This place is a dump. I got my credit card stolen in this hotel and my neighbor got his watch stolen too. On top of that it is impossible to have a quiet night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels for same or less money”
Reviews.Author: travlr4life
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Barcelona at Opera Palace, Pros Internet Free Close to Ramblas ( this is a con also) Friendly staff Cons Small rooms Dirty and noisy on first floor Better newer hotels available for the same or less Too close to Las Ramblas Dark (black painted hallways with lights off at night only triggered by motion, you have to walk in to a pitch black hallway until a working sensor turns on the lights) Overall not a good value, look for a hotel in the newer area of barcelona, come visit Las Ramblas, but don't stay here, lots of graffiti, poor area, and loud with a lot of drunks late at night on the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good!!”
Reviews.Author: sc-wigan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends for 3 nights, returning yesterday. The only good thing about the hotel is its location, very central. Our room was cramped and, in order to get to one side of the bed you had to squeeze past the desk which was in a ridiculous place. We were forever bumping into the desk or stubbing our toes on the desk chairs. Our room overlooked an alleyway, which was scruffy and covered in graffiti. The balcony was unkempt, with most of the paving stones broken. The bathroom was tired. Although the fittings were nice, they were let down by poor paintwork, peeling walls, dirty grouting and a general poor finish all round. Taking a shower simply soaked the bathroom through and putting the tap on soaked the top through as the water splashed out of the sink. The air conditioning was really noisy too. The laptop, whilst a nice touch, was scruffy and incredibly slow,not a patch on the British City Inns which have a Mac in the room! The bed was hard and the bed linen cheap and thin. The worst thing though was the noise throughout the night. On the first night it was shouting and arguing which stopped at around 5.30am. At around 5.50am some builders started work and seemed to be throwing objects around such was the noise!. Second night wasn't too bad, but the 3rd night was back to all night activity and shouting. Not sure where it was coming from but thought it may have been the garden or simply in the alleyway. The garden itself was scruffy and dirty. Also don't have breakfast in Cheers across the alleyway...whilst it is good for a drink, its breakfasts are best avoided!! This is definitely not what I would consider to be a 4 star hotel...take your budget for your stay and find somwhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “small, side alley off ramblas”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveller77
Reviews.Content: quite modern, but lacking in the quality of detail, + good location + liked the free WLAN - though good location, not directly on ramblas, thus tipical side alley nuisance (watch your pockets) - very small rooms, cubicals - very basic breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Spot on”
Reviews.Author: dottie07
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here with five girlfriends for a 'big' birthday and could not have been happier with the location, rooms, reception, cleanliness and atmosphere. The hotel is in an old building and has an impressive huge carved wooden door but inside all is modern and minimalist. The garden area behind reception is pretty but there are lots of steps to reach all the levels. We didn't try the bar as there are loads of bars and cafes nearby. Helpful staff and loads of leaflets at reception. We chose 'room only' as it is far cheaper to get a breakfast of anywhere choice in the city (Cafe de L'Opera round the corner is divine). Each of the three rooms we had was spacious and spotless, with big bathrooms and walk-in showers. Ours had a small balcony and all windows had blackout curtains as well as voiles. Like most hotels, it didn't have many hangers but that would be my only gripe. Each of the rooms had the facility to be turned into a family room but the beds were discreetly folded up against the wall in all the rooms, sometimes behind a wardrobe area. There was free internet access and a laptop in each room which was useful once we discovered how to get @ on a Spanish keyboard (Alt/Gr plus the @ key). I'd stayed right on the Ramblas once before but this was just far enough away to avoid the late night noise (except on the night when Barcelona beat Chelsea, ha!). Being so central the hotel is just near the Liceu metro station and within easy stretch of all the sights and shopping. The street outside the hotel is pedestrianised but t is only about 25 yards from Las Ramblas. We booked private transport from the airport and stopped on Las Ramblas but the driver helped us right into reception with the luggage (and the reverse on the return trip).

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel ,excellent location , clean and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: jueyanne
Reviews.Content: we arrived at hotel to be pleasantly surprised by how near to the ramblas we were . we had a family room for myself and 3 other girls in our 40 s on a city break for the weekend.Our room was large and clean with a terrace over looking the garden that lit up beautifully at night.There was a large mod tv on wall and a laptop all free .It doesnt mention kettles in room on website so we did take one luckily.Our room was cleaned every day with fresh towels replaced .we heard no noise at night in fact we slept like logs the beds were good.we found the staff friendly and helpful and we would use this hotel again for sure.we had a fabulous holiday and loved barcelona .

Reviews.Title: “Not Good Enough! Don't go if you are a family.”
Reviews.Author: Jacfam
Reviews.Content: When we did a search for a family room this hotel came up. The room was big enough and they did provide a cot - which kept breaking - this is as far as the family service went - no kettle in the room. Bar fridge - mouldy stickers on old drink bottles - other peoples empty bottles left in the fridge. Furniture tired and tatty. Service terrible, we asked if someone could bring us some ice as their bar was only open in July - we wanted a quick drink before going to dinner (all the bars/pubs weren't particularly family friendly either) the girl behind the desk said she couldn't leave reception.

Reviews.Title: “No way a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: MrsSmith1000
Reviews.Content: Very dissappointed with this hotel, the website makes the rooms look very nice when in fact they are poorly fitted out, not too clean, toiletteries are very cheap and nasty, no extractor fan in the bathroom which meant a very black and mouldy ceiling above the bath! Staff very laid back, I had to ask three times for some glasses in our room they never arrived. breakfasts okay if you get in at 7.30 if not a bit sparse and you take your life in your hands if you use the coffee machine! Location very good, and a beautiful garden which just needs to be kept a bit tidier. With such a beautiful building, location and garden this could be an amazing hotel but it lacks that special touch you would expect from a four star.

Reviews.Title: “No restaurant No bar”
Reviews.Author: JohnRowan
Reviews.Content: You should know that there is no restaurant apart from breakfast, and no bar at all. A hotel without a bar seems very strange to me. The hotel is labelled as High Tech on every piece of print, and the whole emphasis is on the male business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: groovydee
Reviews.Content: This is a terrible hotel. They had no hot water for the duration of our visit and after complaining 5 times did they own up to the fact that there was something wrong with the plumbing. Not to mention the water also stagnated in the bathroom. After numerous complaints they suggested I go to another room in another building to take a shower!! For a 4 star hotel this was the worst ever and real bad value for money. Worst is not being compensated since I prepaid. Also trying to sleep in that hotel was impossible since you can hear every door and elevator sounds in that hotel. Avoid like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: cat65London
Reviews.Content: This hotel can't be beaten for location in Barcelona. Just off La Rambla with excellent public transport links. Rooms were clean, breakfasts were fine and we also made use of the Tapas bar opposite on a couple of occasions. The decor is all very new and modern and the only fault I can find is that it seems too flimsy and too cheap. The sliding wardrobe doors looked a little worse for wear and areas of the dining room would benefit from a lick of paint. Overall, this is a great place from which to explore the city. If you are a football fan, make sure you get to go to a match at the Nou Camp! Accessible from here without too much hassle.

Reviews.Title: “A good standard of accommodation in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JoanneDavies
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 3 friends in August - in a family room! Despite 4 adults sharing, the room was perfectly adequate for the amount of time you spend in it on a city break. 2 of the beds are "bunk bed" style - but much more comfortable than we expected. All looks recently refurbished and modern. Great shower. This hotel is fabulously located - within seconds of Las Ramblas and the Boqueria market and a few minutes walk from the everything else the Bari Gottic area has to offer. Only thing that lets this place down is the lack of decent bar. They have a great terrace & gardens out the back of the hotel, but no one serving drinks. When we came in to see if we could get a drink from the "so called" bar, the guy basically had nothing on offer except coffee! Service was generally a little slow, but staff were helpful. Would recommend and would return

Reviews.Title: “break in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: JuneIsleofWight
Reviews.Content: my friend and i wanted a few nights stay in Barcelona without the hassle of public transport every where we went. The hotel was a fantastic location, didn't need breakfast as there was a tapas bar just across the street. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was large and clean. Bathroom fantastic. Bar could have been open more frequently - just to enjoy sitting in the garden area - but this was not a major problem. If every I return to Barcelona, which I hope to do. would not hesitate in staying here again, or recommending to friends. Thank you for a fantastic break

Reviews.Title: “Stolen bag at breakfast”
Reviews.Author: barneyx
Reviews.Content: Ok hotel, looks better on the web than it actually is, very over priced. securtiy is dire, anybody can walk in off the street without being questioned as i learnt!! i had my bag containing wallet, passport and camera stole from underneath my table during the breakfast serving, the guy who stole it enters the hotel and serves himself breakfast, other guests think he is staying at the hotel, but he is just there to steal from you. the hotel are aware it has happened before but do not warn guests, the few staff that is in the hotel attemped to help but by that time he was long gone along with another ladies bag. i realise your own belongings are your own responsibility, but surely a 4 star hotel has a duty to provide guests with basic security, safer sleeping on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy. Clean. Polite staff. Great location. but Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: CTFAMILY
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights pre-cruise. I booked with Venere.com. We chose this hotel for its "family rooms"-a room where we can all 4 stay. The price seemed mid-range to me. I found its location to be ideal. We walked to many places, restaurants, tourist sites. The room was small but clean and adequate. The staff were english speaking, and helpful. We did not purchase breakfast at hotel. We ate at local cafes. However, unfortunately, we will not choose this hotel again. While I did enjoy our room with tiny balcony overlooking a side street on Las Ramblas, we found it very difficult to sleep. We could hear all sorts of folks on the streets, many partiers, and lots outbursts until the wee hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LullaEire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really comfortable, clean, perfectly located and boasts a friendly staff. One memorable incident which involved the cleaning lady entering the room, despite us having put up the "do not disturb" sign, resulted in the staff leaving us complimentary champagne and fruit! A lovely touch!! A really enjoyable stay but somewhat overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Petit Palace”
Reviews.Author: MarioPaiva
Reviews.Content: I´ve stayed in Petit Palace Opera for 4 nights. Their mayor positive point is the location...Just near a tube station...Everything became very near this way... Let´s start from the beginning. When we arrived to the Hotel the baggage man has come to take the bags to the reception...nice impression..... Then became the first mistake.... The reception boy has made a mistake and checked us in a small room, not the requested one, not the one we asked for....But well mistakes we can all make..Another thing I didn´t like was that room service was only till 23 hours.... But then happened something I consider absolutely irresponsible and not the expected from a 4 stars hotel.... In the breakfast the cereals were out of date... (9/2007).... This was unforgivable and unacceptable from a 4 star hotel... But there were some positive points as the room towel service....and the simpathy of all the employees. Positive Points: Location, Price Negative Points: Breakfast, Room Service

Reviews.Title: “Very well located & well presented hotel”
Reviews.Author: SJANDJ
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have just returned from staying one night at this hotel & I have to say that it is in a great position just off La Ramblas.It was much closer than I thought & very easy to find.The hotel is modern & clean, with a very modern & good sized shower room.We have a double sized shower at home & this one was as big, complete with Jacuzzi style shower.Not bad for a 4 star hotel! The staff were very friendly & helpful, not that we needed much as we were only there for the one night, but still, I got the impression they would have helped out with any problems you may have. The only issue we had with the room was the bed.It was bigger than a king size but very, very hard!My husband says he might aswell have slept on the floor it was that uncomfortable, but maybe it's just him as I slept just fine! I would definitely book this hotel again when we return in April (if it's available), mainly due to it's great location.There are so many bars & restaurants close by, you will certianly find one that suits your taste & budget.

Reviews.Title: “hmm...”
Reviews.Author: pbeart13
Reviews.Content: we stayed here shortly after it was completely redecorated.. many issues, part of ceiling not in, leaky shower etc, very clean though, but lots of building pieces to finish. wasnt wowed, actually wanted to come home earlier, but then wasnt that impressed by the city anyway.. trip culminated in seeing two naked people on the balcony of a residential flat as i lay on the bed, not nice..!

Reviews.Title: “Far away from beeing hi tech......”
Reviews.Author: fipol
Reviews.Content: It was mid of November 2007 when I stayed at the Opera Garden but I still remember as it was yesterday...... My friends and I decided to visit barcelona. Well, I 've been looking for a hotel with a good location, recently restored but with at least 4 stars service. My choice went on the opera Garden but apart the location everything went on the wrong way. Rooms a much likely to a Easyhotel than a four stars property, hard beds, fluorecent colors , bad lightings if ever working, poor maintenance are just a few of the points the management should really take care. Not mentioning the pure promotional effect of the " HIGH TECH " term: not a sign of hi tech interactivity, no internet on tv, no renting of portable pc , nothing that one could think of high technology apart from a couple of portable pc locked on the counter of the empty bar with a basic dsl connectivity. Would I spend again my and my friends' money at this hotel? Noooooo way!!! Even the few staff was somewhat bored of listening always to the same complaints: impossible taking a shower without wetting all the floor, impossible having a bulb of your lamp changed, irrelevant complaining that a lamp on the wall of you room is missing and there is a hole with open wires that needs to be closed. Last, irrelevant complaining for booking a "familiar" and getting a somewhat standard room with two added beds. Are you young (less than 35) and got a rate of 100 euro per night........then book it ! Everything above that is just a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel in Barca that'll take children”
Reviews.Author: LHF
Reviews.Content: Hotel is half way down Las Ramblas, just 20 mtrs along one of the many small streets. The hotel entrance is very nice, the rooms are clean but very basic. It's MDF heaven, everythings made of it. Our room was in an annex that is reached by crossing the garden area. There are stairs but the porter took our cases so it wasn't a problem. I don't think I'd stay there again but very few hotels in Barcelona caters for a family of 4. It's convenient, clean and the staff are nice. The breakfast is the worst I've ever had and if you want a drink "in the bar" you have to sit outside. The beds are very hard, after 4 nights I was glad to get home to my comfy bed. It's cheap, reasonably cheerful and is clean.

Reviews.Title: “really nice staff but this new hotel needs repairs and improvements”
Reviews.Author: terance
Reviews.Content: hello i stayed at this hotel 11th nov 2007 to 16th nov 2007 i had read mixed reviews on tripadvisor but took a chance because some reviews had said the good location outweighed the problems .in my opinion it is not a high tech hotel in any way at all the entrance hall is the best part of the hotel its 20 metres up a side street half way down the famous rambles the twenty metres is frequented by prostitutes but to be honest unless you were looking for them you would not notice them they are very young and concentrate on young men so my wife and i were safe we are fifty anyway once in the hotel it looks good but the rooms are badly fitted out the furniture is poor quality the tv is nice but only sky news is in english language the rest is spanish and german and french the glass door to the bathroom is nice others commented on it being a problem but if you are sharing a room with someone you should be able to cope with a green glass door you cannot see anything other than a shadow through the glass however the shower screens are useless and water on floor is unavoidable sound proofing is rubbish.beds are hard but i like that so no complaints.the breakfast on three out of five mornings was poor no replenishment so if you went after nine the choice was very poor indeed.the gardens in the centre of the building are a feature of this hotel but in november pretty useless but in a large hot city in summertime i reckon it would be fab for cooling in its shade. getting there take a taxi to 78 rambles 30 mins 30 euros from el prat airport the tapas bar opposite front door of hotel highly recommended excellent food and wine and cold beer nice people run it

Reviews.Title: “Great Garden!”
Reviews.Author: lamontravel
Reviews.Content: The Petit Palace Posada Opera was in a great location just off of Las Ramblas in the old section of Barcelona. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were immaculate, like another Petit Palace we had stayed in in Madrid. The "Family Suite" is a great set-up for a family of four like ours. There is a king bed and two bunk beds that are mounted on the wall. The bathroom is large. Heed the warnings about the water getting all over as the glass enclosure only goes part of the way, and not behind the stream of water. You will need to only use the handheld nozzle, and even then, still clean up afterwards. That is not a reason not to book this hotel! The garden was lovely, and we enjoyed several evenings of sipping wine, while our children (ages 9 and 11) played in the garden with the kids (ages 11 and 14) from our accompanying friends' family. Breakfast for us was included in the price, but it was not quite as extensive a spread as the Petit Palace in Madrid; but for the price, it was good enough. I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: CapeTown78
Reviews.Content: Good location and liked the funky decor... However, it is overpriced and not all the reception staff are that friendly. Close to restaurants and don't miss the market nearby!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: duellema
Reviews.Content: At first glance this is a fantastic modern hotel. It is located directly off La Ramblas in my favorite area of the city. It is very close to the indoor market and public transport. I saw several people passing and looking because it was so elegant amidst spray painted garage doors. There were small details that were strange - as others have noted you cannot take a shower without spraying the floor. That being said, the showers are quite nice. The dark hallways didn't bother me. I think it perhaps covers up the shoddy paint job. The black matte paint shows any and all imperfections. I wasn't really staying here for the hallways though. The 'sewage' smell others mentioned is something I noticed all over Barcelona. It wasn't something I noticed much when we were in our room. It was sweltering in the city, which I am sure did not help. The breakfast is good, however I wouldn't pay extra for it. We had it included in our rate, which was incredibly inexpensive. My 'complaints' were one day we set off early and came back around 4pm and our room was still not cleaned. It was going to be more of a hassle for us to leave so they could do it. Another issue we had was coming back around 1am on a Saturday night and the doors were locked. We had to ring the buzzer several times and wait a few minutes. I'm happy we stayed so central for our first visit. I would recommend this hotel for the location and modern design. If marks on the wall are going to irritate you, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay”
Reviews.Author: StuJ_7
Reviews.Content: Stay in June, 07, Good location, next to some seedy streets, at night beware of all the prositutes hanging out at the corner, they tried to pick up my husband and 13 year old son. leading up to the room you must enter dark hallways, they have BLACK wall paper on walls and motion lights that go on only when you enter the hallway. Motion lights are very dim. VERY SCAREY. You will never know if someone is hiding in corner of hallway. Once the lights turn on you already walked down a completely dark hallway with no windows. Upon entering the room the accent pillows on bed had staines not only in my room as well as my friends room too. and the room they changed us to also. Cockaroches and flies in the room, spend all night killing flies, changed rooms because the overwhelming smell of sewer coming from the bathroom. Hotel had power failer and you better have your own flashlight because you are in complete darkness. My friend fell down the stairs because no lights on stairs. My friend spend vacation time in the hospital with sprain foot and torn ligaments. Manager said they cannot put emergency lights because they are on a historic site. DO NOT STAY HERE !!!! There are better hotels in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Very Stylish”
Reviews.Author: LeeKent
Reviews.Content: Really loved the swish and contemporary look of this hotel. Managed to get an excellent rate from hotels.com at 65% off the hotels standard rates. The rooms and bathrooms are of an excellent standard. One down side to the hotel is that they can only manually switch from aircon or heat in summer and winter. Although it was November, it was particularly humid and the rooms very hot. They were unable to switch any air-conditioning on and suggested opening a window! The breakfast buffet was very good and the staff very attentive. With it’s perfect location, I would recommend this hotel but check out what offers you can get first as it’s not the cheapest.
